snippet: The Irish building company will increase leverage to buy surplus assets from Lafarge worth a third of its market cap. Yet investors cheered. It’s how things work in a low-return, low-growth world, says Chris Hughes of Reuters Breakingviews.
abstract: The Irish building company will increase leverage to buy surplus assets from Lafarge worth a third of its market cap. Yet investors cheered. It’s how things work in a low-return, low-growth world, says Chris Hughes of Reuters Breakingviews.

headline.main: $7.3 Billion Cement Deals Shows Tolerance to M.&A.
